article:
won 511 games during his career, 94 more than second-place Walter
 Johnson. |alt=A man in a cap and jacket walks on a dirt road carrying
 a walking stick in his right hand.]] Major League Baseball recognizes the
 player or players in each league with the most wins each season. In baseball,
 wins are a statistic used to evaluate pitchers. Credit for a win is given by
 the official scorer to the pitcher whose team takes and maintains the lead
 while he is the pitcher of record. If a game is tied or if the lead changes to
 the other team, all pitchers who have participated and exited the game to that
 point are unable to receive credit for the victory. A starting pitcher is
 ineligible for the win if he has not completed five or more innings of the
 game; instead, the scorer would award the victory to the relief pitcher who was
 "most effective... in the official scorer's judgment".
